Description:
A Confident First Step with this Art Deco Sensation
Capturing the quintessential character of Art Deco architecture, Dorrington House with its decorated cement facade, barley sugar columns, evocative archways and romantic staircases is still very much a sought-after Howard Lawson creation opposite the Yarra River. Dressed with decorative ceilings, an ornate open fireplace, timber flooring and plantation shutters, this appealing elevated apartment excites with a north facing position, sensational river views from each window and generous proportions throughout. An updated kitchen and bathroom accompany the expansive living/dining zone and the enormous sun-filled bedroom with feature bay window. Parkland, the Royal Botanic Gardens, Yarra River and its bike and running trails, plus the highly regarded Lawson Grove Shop are mere seconds away whilst dining, shops and public transport are all within easy reach.

Refined Elegance, River and City Views and Absolute Privacy In Secure Park-like Grounds
